courses.title: Introduction to Programming
courses.description: Foundational programming concepts using Python. This course introduces students to computational thinking, problem-solving, and programming fundamentals. No prior experience required. Students will learn variables, control flow, functions, data structures, and object-oriented programming through hands-on projects.
learning_objectives: Understand core concepts in introduction to programming
Implement introduction to programming algorithms and techniques
Apply introduction to programming to real-world problems
Analyze and evaluate introduction to programming solutions
Design and build complete computer science systems

courses.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
courses.description: Essential data structures and algorithmic problem-solving. This course covers arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, graphs, and hash tables. Students will analyze algorithm complexity and implement efficient solutions to computational problems.

prerequisites.course_title: Prerequisite for Data Structures and Algorithms

learning_objectives: Understand core concepts in data structures and algorithms
Implement data structures and algorithms algorithms and techniques
Apply data structures and algorithms to real-world problems
Analyze and evaluate data structures and algorithms solutions
Design and build complete computer science systems

courses.title: Database Systems
courses.description: Relational databases, SQL, and data modeling. This course covers database design, normalization, SQL programming, and transaction management. Students will design and implement databases for real-world applications.
learning_objectives: Understand core concepts in database systems
Implement database systems algorithms and techniques
Apply database systems to real-world problems
Analyze and evaluate database systems solutions

courses.title: Web Development
courses.description: Full-stack web development with modern frameworks. Students will build responsive web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and Node.js. Topics include REST APIs, authentication, and deployment.

Implement web development algorithms and techniques

courses.title: Software Engineering
courses.description: Software development lifecycle, design patterns, and best practices. This course covers requirements analysis, system design, testing, and maintenance. Students will work in teams to build a substantial software project using agile methodologies.
learning_objectives: Understand core concepts in software engineering
Implement software engineering algorithms and techniques

courses.title: Operating Systems
courses.description: Process management, memory, file systems, and concurrency. This course explores how operating systems manage hardware resources and provide services to applications. Topics include scheduling, virtual memory, and synchronization.

courses.title: Computer Networks
courses.description: Network protocols, architecture, and internet technologies. This course covers the OSI model, TCP/IP, routing, and network security. Students will analyze network traffic and implement network applications.
learning_objectives: Understand core concepts in computer networks

courses.description: Advanced neural network architectures and deep learning techniques. This course explores convolutional neural networks, recurrent networks, transformers, and generative models. Students will implement state-of-the-art architectures using PyTorch and apply them to real-world problems in vision, language, and beyond.

courses.description: Text processing, language models, and NLP applications. This course covers the fundamentals of computational linguistics, from tokenization to large language models. courses.title: Linear Algebra for Machine Learning
courses.description: Vectors, matrices, and linear transformations for ML applications. This course provides the mathematical foundation essential for understanding machine learning algorithms. courses.title: Pre-Calculus
courses.description: Functions, trigonometry, and preparation for calculus. This course builds the algebraic and trigonometric foundations needed for success in calculus. courses.title: Calculus I
courses.description: Limits, derivatives, and introduction to integration. This course covers single-variable calculus, including limits, continuity, differentiation, and basic integration. Students will apply calculus to optimization problems, related rates, and area calculations.

Implement calculus i algorithms and techniques

courses.title: Calculus II
courses.description: Integration techniques, sequences, series, and parametric equations. This course continues single-variable calculus with advanced integration methods, infinite series, and parametric curves. Applications include arc length, surface area, and Taylor series.
learning_objectives: Understand core concepts in calculus ii
Implement calculus ii algorithms and techniques
Apply calculus ii to real-world problems
